yoruba: A pè ọ́ lọ́mọ erín-màgbọn ò ńyọ̀; ìwọ pàápàá ló mì í?
gold: You are described as the child of the elephant that swallows coconuts, and you rejoice; are you the one who swallows coconuts?
gen:
Yoruba: A pè ọ́ lọ́mọ erín-màgbọn ò ńyọ̀; ìwọ pàápàá ló mì í?
English: You are called the child of an elephant and you are not proud; are you the one who swallowed it?
